thread.title: Cowboys were no match for Rob Gronkowski's stiff-arms
thread.title_full: Cowboys were no match for Rob Gronkowski's stiff-arms

title: Cowboys were no match for Rob Gronkowski's stiff-arms
text:
By Des Bieler October 11 at 9:27 PM Follow @DesBieler Yeah, it probably makes more sense to go for the ball than to try to tackle Rob Gronkowski. (Matthew Emmons/USA Today Sports) 
Sometimes when Rob Gronkowski is matched up against smaller players, it just doesn’t seem fair. Actually, that’s the case most of the time. 
The Patriots tight end is too fast for most linebackers, and he’s simply too strong for any defensive back. Gronk proved that again in New England’s 30-6 win over Dallas Sunday, especially on one particular play, when he manhandled a pair of hapless Cowboys defenders. 
After catching a third-quarter pass from Tom Brady while battling tight coverage from cornerback Byron Jones, Gronkowski was able to get away from Jones with a stiff-arm. Actually, he didn’t get away from Jones so much as toss the Cowboy aside like an empty can of Shiner Bock. Rob Gronkowski is great at football pic.twitter.com/bUiicpBamx 
— Rich Hill (@PP_Rich_Hill) October 11, 2015 Did Gronk just throw Byron Jones out of the club? 
— Judy Battista (@judybattista) October 11, 2015 
J.J. Wilcox was eventually able to make the tackle, but not before the safety ate yet another Gronkowski stiff-arm and went for a five-yard ride. Gronk Catch. Gronk Stiff Arm. Gronk Run. Gronk MEGA Stiff Arm. 1st Down! #NEvsDAL http://t.co/c4C2n8IimB
